field_journal.title: Field Journal

puma.name: Puma
puma.description: The puma is a large feline native to the Americas, with a wide distribution from Canada to southern Chile and Argentina. It is a solitary and adaptable hunter that inhabits diverse ecosystems, including the Patagonian steppe and Andean forests.

huillin.name: Southern River Otter
huillin.description: The huill√≠n is a river otter native to southern Chile and Argentina. It is a semi-aquatic mammal that inhabits rivers, lakes and freshwater estuaries.

pudu.name: Pud√∫
pudu.description: The pud√∫ is the world's smallest deer, endemic to the forests of southern Chile and Argentina.

ranadedarwin.name: Darwin's Frog
ranadedarwin.description: Small anuran amphibian endemic to the temperate forests of Chile and Argentina, notable for its unique parental care.

carpintero.name: Magellanic Woodpecker
carpintero.description: The largest woodpecker in South America, inhabiting native forests of southern Chile and Argentina.

chucao.name: Chucao Tapaculo
chucao.description: Endemic bird of the temperate forests of Chile and Argentina, known for its characteristic song.

martinpescador.name: Ringed Kingfisher
martinpescador.description: Aquatic bird that inhabits near rivers, lakes and coasts, known for its fishing ability.

zorrodedarwin.name: Darwin's Fox
zorrodedarwin.description: Canid endemic to Chile, considered one of the rarest canids in the world.
